intro: Kadua glomerata, commonly known as the clustered kadua, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, often on rocky or clay soils. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Kadua glomerata is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the region.
